alert.note: Alert for Gila; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 2:39PM MST until July 30 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Bush Fire burn scar in... Gila County in east central Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 645 PM MST. * At 239 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Bush Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in excessive runoff and possible debris flow moving through Reno Creek, Sycamore Creek, and Slate Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Bush Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Bush Fire Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sunflower, Punkin Center and Tonto Basin. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 188 between mile markers 261 and 266. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 216 and 225. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sycamore Creek and East Fork Sycamore Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
